title: Foveated Ray Tracing for VR Headsets

author: Michał Chwesiuk, Faculty of Computer Science, West Pomeranian University of Technology - ZUT

segmentation: OK, thank you for the introduction, and my name is milkfish Okyeman, PhD student from West Pomeranian, University of Technology, in stretching from Poland from Faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology and I have pleasure to present to you our work for video rendering for Vita try tracing for views to reality headsets.
OK, so first I want to start with brief explanation of terms used in our study.
Main goal of computer graphics is to.
Essay focused on synthesis of image.
It's like this one.
This is the image of virtual 3 dimensional scene and we want to synthesize them using computer algorithms.
Process of generations of images like this one, is called rendering.
Rendering should synthesize image of virtual scene in such a way that mimics phenomena that exist in real world, such as objects, properties, distribution of lights and shadow.
Ray tracing is well know technique, which is however very calm, very complex do at a large number of Rays that should be traced.
Rendering process can be used in an environment such as virtual reality.
Observer who's very specialized head mounted display look through lenses at their enter a scene that simulate real world.
Ray tracing for VR Systems is challenging for current graphics systems.
Today's systems don't have enough resolution to fully simulate the real world.
They reach around six sequence.
Agree, when human human visual system is capable of requires to fully.
To fully see to.
OK, to fully simulate what we require to render 60 cycles per degree, which Additionally skies up requirements requirements for Ray tracing.
In this slide you can see to render scenes on the left boundary box and the right one is as you said.
These scenes were rendered on VR system using Raytracing algorithm.
With modern GPU's you can see the rendering time for the first one was equal to 50 milliseconds, and for the second one is 66 milliseconds.
This which means that it is acquirement of 20 frames per degree per second, and 50 frames per second.
Which is not enough becausw via virtual reality system requires 19 frames per second.
Which which is 11 milliseconds.
Yeah, each frame must be rendered in 11 seconds, so you can observe this is too slow.
In our rating system we use so-called foveated rendering.
It means that I tracker capture gaze direction of the observer an image is rendered taking into account information of human visual system.
Acuity of the human vision in the periphery is much lower than in the fovea, which allows us to significantly significantly reduce the number of tracer tries.
Retina in human eye contains photoreceptors called cones, which are responsible for gathering information about observe, seen distribution of these photoreceptors is not homogeneous.
Area in Central Region contains more cons, and this number is reduced towards periphery regions.
This phenomenon is described by guys dependent counters activity function.
We can observe that when we increase eccentricity, which means we increased distance from center area, the ability of perceiving details in observe scenes is slower is decreasing.
To conclude, we can only see details of the scene in the central region while in periphery.
They are difficult to not notice.
On this slide you can see our fitted rendering system that we developed in our research.
We use eye tracker to capture temporal guys point based on this guys point.
The sampling mask is applied which indicates direction of traced race.
Distribution of samples in the subject mask is not regular and follows guys dependent contrast sensitivity function.
Computed samples are transformed to the regular Cartesian image in this phase.
In yeah, computed samples are transferred to the regular Curtis.
An image in the face we call the reconstruction.
On this next slide you can see examples of some tick marks we tested in our foveated rendering system.
White dots in their masks indicate samples that were taken into account.
And through this pixels, the race will trace it.
Max that contain 5054 percentage of pixels follows their contrast activity function and our research is focused on using this mask.
Three other masks are to test different distribution of generated trace.
On the right you can see the triangle mesh which vertices are located in the samples from sampling mask.
We use this match to reconstruct the final courtesy and image.
Just in this light you can see example of rendering using sampling mask.
The image contains black blank pixels that are not yet filled with color.
Becaused rice were not tested through them.
This horse will be filled in the reconstruction phase.
Under this light you can see the full resolution rendering against foveated rendering after reconstruction phase with the Grace Point located in the center of the image.
As you can see in the insets, images on the right contains more details.
However, as these details are located in periphery, the degradation of the image is not visible for the observer.
Here we can observe the comparison of the fighter entering in the second season and the full resolution rendering in the second scene.
You can see that and like in the in the previous.
Seen.
The address are sharp in the floor entry in the full resolution during while in the foveated rendering there are.
There exist some artifacts there, but these artifacts is not visible in the peripheral region.
We preferred measurement of fluid rendering from some table.
You can conclude that for me to turn drink reduce rendering time for mass consistent with contrast activity function we obtain.
2.2 speed up and 2.1 setup so.
We we increase the rendering time twice.
And for the mask of 80%, we even increased it higher, but the mask with 54 points percentage of pixels is correct with contrast sensitivity function.
In future VR systems with higher resolutions acceleration will be even more significant.
We tested degradation of image quality caused by for visit rendering.
We ask 6 volunteers to wear VR goggles and freely observed the scene.
During this time, the full resolution rendering was randomly replaced with the free Vita at rendering based on the one of the four masks selected randomly.
The Observer task was to press keyboard whenever he or she notice the change of the mask.
Whole procedure lasted about 5 minutes.
On this slide, the results of the experiment are presented.
Plot shows how many times observers notice observers notice the change of their sampling mask.
The number of times was normalized to range from minus one to plus plus one.
As you can see, for the 4154% touch masks, observers barely notice the change of the mask, which is good for our foveated rendering system.
For some other mask, this change was easily noticeable, which indicates that this mask cannot be used at info it rendering system.
To conclude.
We developed for that rendering system in virtual reality environment that reduce the number of trace Rays dependent on characteristic of human visual system.
This method speeds up rendering two times.
In future work we plan to add temporal antialiasing to our foveated for Ray tracer because we know tist that temporal Areas Inc is a real problem in the current virtual reality systems.
Thank you for your attention.
